sentences.english: I work out on a daily basis and I play racquetball in between.
sentences.chinese: 我每天按部就班地外出工作，並在閒暇時玩壁球。

sentences.english: Leisure is a house, not often wear.
sentences.chinese: 閒暇是霓裳，不宜常穿用。

sentences.english: I traveled NYC a couple of times with my friends while I was off.
sentences.chinese: 在閒暇之餘，我和朋友們一起去紐約遊玩過幾次。

sentences.english: He jotted down the conceits of his idle hours.
sentences.chinese: 他記下了閒暇時想到的一些看法。

sentences.english: They treasure their leisure with measureless pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 他們以無限的快樂珍惜他們的閒暇時間。

sentences.english: How important is it for employees to have time outside work?
sentences.chinese: 員工在工作之餘擁有閒暇時間有何重要性？

sentences.english: As for recreations, there are so many that we lose count of them.
sentences.chinese: 此外，學生們自己在閒暇時也經常組織一些娛樂活動。

sentences.english: Even now during my part-time, I drew some goldfish for pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 閒暇時光有時會拿起畫筆，畫金魚玩。

sentences.english: Good conversation during walks or while the couple is relaxing can be a great aphrodisiac.
sentences.chinese: 散步或閒暇時的愉快談話便是一劑春宮妙藥。

sentences.english: What do you usually do on weekends if you have free time?
sentences.chinese: 週末閒暇之餘，你通常做些什麼呢？

sentences.english: Leisure , them gather a, go to outskirt to step spring.
sentences.chinese: 閒暇時，它們聚集一起，到郊外踏春。

sentences.english: I play with my children like am if I get time.
sentences.chinese: 閒暇時間和孩子玩耍，像只猴兒。

sentences.english: My father likes reading in his spare time.
Usually, the old men will drink morning tea, which is their main relaxation during leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 通常喝早茶的是老年人，這是他們閒暇時主要的活動。

sentences.english: Li Fen advises me to read more books in my spare time.
sentences.chinese: 李芬建議我閒暇時多看些書。

definition: gap (between two objects)/interval of time (between events)/opening in one's schedule/free time/(fig.) gap (in the market etc)
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to go on a scenic tour
to look for/to seek/to find fault
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
